intro: Hauya elegans subsp. lucida, commonly known as the shining hauya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Peru and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
